title: ID: Johnson Controls
content:
What typeface is this?

Thanks in advance.  
Dave

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 9.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%209_5.png) | 20.36 KB |

 [‹ YALE University font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/typophile.com/node/48499 "Go to previous forum topic") [Script face used on "Robot Milk" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/typophile.com/node/48493 "Go to next forum topic")
author: DavM

comments.content:
Hi David,

it’s a modified [Corisande](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.identifont.com/show?9SM).

[Came up before](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37829). Tip: You can [run a search](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20johnson%20controls) if you know what you’re looking for.  
F

... just not with the search box in the corner. Shouldn’t that either be fixed or removed? Or replaced with a Google widget?

(I do see that your search link is via Google.)

Max, you’re right.  
It is a [known issue](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37117) – been [for years](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29729#comment-170416).

The good news: there’s a workaround: [Searching Typophile Archives](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12344) via a favelet by [Grant Hutchinson](http://web.archive.org/web/20080820001534/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Grant%252BHutchinson%252B).  
F
It’s really a shame because it means people will ask again and again what, for instance, the Obama campaign font is, even after they’ve done a search on “Obama,” which turns up nothing.
